title: Ian Wright names Chelsea legend Didier Drogba as the best no.9 in Premier League history
text:
Didier Drogba spent nine years at Stamford Bridge (Picture: Getty) Arsenal legend Ian Wright believes former Chelsea forward Didier Drogba is the best no.9 in the history of the Premier League.
Drogba, 38, spent nine years at Stamford Bridge over two stints at the club and he scored 164 goals in 380 appearances for the Blues.
Alexis Sanchez responds to Arsenal speculation with cryptic Instagram post The Ivory Coast international only surpassed 20+ league goals in two campaigns with Chelsea but he’s widely recognised as one of the greatest players in the club’s history.
And Wright believes the former Marseille forward is the best no.9 in Premier League history.
Wright is a huge fan of Drogba (Picture: Getty) ‘I think [Diego]Costa is brilliant but he’s not better than Didier Drogba,’ Wright told BT Sport.
‘Drogba’s the best no 9 I’ve seen playing up front on his own. I’d say one of the best [players in Premier League history].
‘In terms of big players, big moments, big goals in cup finals, Drogba is right up there.’
